title: 108_hr1253
content: The Act is titled the "Common Sense Preble's Conservation Act" and includes special requirements regarding the Preble's meadow jumping mouse under the Endangered Species Act of 1973. Sec. 13 of the "Common Sense Preble's Conservation Act" mandates the use of the best scientific and commercial data available for determining the status of the Preble's meadow jumping mouse as an endangered or threatened species. The Secretary must prioritize empirical or peer-reviewed data and include population numbers in the evaluation. Field data observation is required for making any determination on the species' status under section 4 of the Act. The Secretary must accept data from landowners on the status of the species for rulemaking. Independent scientific review is required for determining the Preble's meadow jumping mouse's status as endangered or threatened. The qualified individual must have expertise in biological sciences and demonstrate scientific expertise on the Preble's meadow jumping mouse or similar species relevant to the Secretary's decision under section 4(a) or (f). The Secretary must appoint independent scientific reviewers who are free from conflicts of interest, not involved in related petitions or determinations, and have no financial stake in opposing the action. Recommendations will be sought from the National Academy of Sciences to create a list of qualified reviewers for independent scientific review of actions. Before finalizing any action, the Secretary must appoint 3 qualified individuals from a list created by the National Academy of Sciences to independently review and report on the scientific information. The reviewers' selection and activities are not governed by the Federal Advisory Committee Act, and they will be compensated for their review within 3 months. The Secretary must appoint 3 qualified individuals to independently review scientific information on the Preble's meadow jumping mouse within 3 months. The final determination will include a summary of the independent scientific review and an explanation if the recommendation is not followed. The report of the peer reviewers on the Preble's meadow jumping mouse must be included in the official record of the proposed action for public review. A conforming amendment is made to the table of sections in the Act. Special requirements for Preble's meadow jumping mouse are outlined in Section 13.
